content: * *Masjid Hang Jebat** ([Jawi](/wiki/Jawi_alphabet): مسجد هڠ جيبت; *Hang Jebat Mosque*) is a [mosque](/wiki/Mosque) in [Queenstown](/wiki/Queenstown,_Singapore), Singapore. It is one of the few old-generation kampung mosques left in Singapore. The mosque was iconic for its close proximity to the former [KTM](/wiki/KTM_Intercity) railway tracks. ## History Located at the end of Jalan Hang Jebat, off Portsdown Avenue, Masjid Hang Jebat started as a [surau](/wiki/Surau) in 1952 for Malay Regiment soldiers and Muslim workers in Wessex Estate. The mosque and its adjacent road took its name from the nearby Hang Jebat military installation which in turn was named after [Hang Jebat](/wiki/Hang_Jebat), one of the legendary Malaccan warriors. When the British withdraw in 1971, the land was opened up and donations were collected to expand to upgrade the institution. In 1973, it gained its status as a mosque. ## Current status Today, the Mosque is managed by [Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura](/wiki/Majlis_Ugama_Islam_Singapura). With the exception of minor upgrades and upkeeping, the mosque still retains its rustic kampung charm. It continues to play an important social role in the community by providing counselling, religious services and tuition classes. The mosque is part of the [Queenstown Heritage Trail](/wiki/My_Queenstown_Heritage_Trail). ## Transportation The mosque is accessible from [Queenstown MRT station](/wiki/Queenstown_MRT_station). - [My Queenstown Heritage Trail](/wiki/My_Queenstown_Heritage_Trail) - [List of mosques](/wiki/List_of_mosques) - [Religion in Singapore](/wiki/Religion_in_Singapore) - [Islam in Singapore](/wiki/Islam_in_Singapore) - [List of mosques in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_mosques_in_Singapore) This article about a [mosque](/wiki/Mosque) or other [Islamic](/wiki/Islamic) place of worship in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Masjid Hang Jebat
